HttpResponseMessageProperty Class

In this Article

Provides access to the HTTP response in order to access and respond to the additional information made available for requests over the HTTP protocol.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class HttpResponseMessageProperty : System.ServiceModel.Channels.IMessageProperty

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • HttpResponseMessageProperty

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

This is a general-purpose class that gives you direct access to the HTTP response information, which could be used for encapsulation of HTTP-specific information. One use of this class is to support services implemented in accordance with the Representational State Transfer (REST) architecture.

This class enables you to support the following scenarios:

  • Controls whether an entity body is transmitted.

  • Allows HTTP header (key, value) pairs to be set for each response.

  • Varies the status code and status description used for each response.

    This class can be used by HttpTransportBindingElement and related classes.

Constructors summary

HttpResponseMessageProperty()

Initializes a new instance of the HttpResponseMessageProperty class.

Properties summary

Headers

Gets the HTTP headers from the HTTP response.
Name

Gets the name of the message property associated with the HttpResponseMessageProperty class.
StatusCode

Gets or sets the status code of the current HTTP response to which this property is attached.
StatusDescription

Gets or sets the description of the status code of the current HTTP response to which this property is attached.
SuppressEntityBody

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the body of the message is ignored and an empty message is sent.
SuppressPreamble

Gets or sets whether the message preamble is suppressed.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IMessageProperty.CreateCopy()

Creates a new copy of the current instance.

Constructors

  • HttpResponseMessageProperty()

    Initializes a new instance of the HttpResponseMessageProperty class.

    public HttpResponseMessageProperty ();

    Remarks

    This constructor initializes the object as follows:

    • StatusCode = HttpStatusCode.

    • StatusDescription is set to null.

    • SuppressEntityBody = false.

Properties

  • Headers

    Gets the HTTP headers from the HTTP response.

    public System.Net.WebHeaderCollection Headers { get; }

    Property Value

    • WebHeaderCollection

      Returns a WebHeaderCollection that contains the HTTP headers in the HTTP response.

    Example

    This shows how to get the HTTP headers from the HTTP response: 

                WebHeaderCollection whCollection =
			responseProperty.Headers;
  • Name

    Gets the name of the message property associated with the HttpResponseMessageProperty class.

    public static string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns "httpResponse".

    Example

    This shows how to get the name of the message property: 

    	    String name = HttpResponseMessageProperty.Name;
  • StatusCode

    Gets or sets the status code of the current HTTP response to which this property is attached.

    public System.Net.HttpStatusCode StatusCode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • HttpStatusCode

      Returns the StatusCode to send on the HTTP response.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value is set to less than 100 or greater than 599.

    Remarks

    This property has one of the values in the HttpStatusCode enumeration.

    Example

    This shows how to get the StatusCode that is sent on the HTTP response: 

    	    HttpStatusCode httpStatusCode =
	        responseProperty.StatusCode;
  • StatusDescription

    Gets or sets the description of the status code of the current HTTP response to which this property is attached.

    public string StatusDescription { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the StatusDescription to send for the HTTP response.

    Remarks

    This property provides a user-friendly description of the returned status code.

    Example

    This shows how to get the description of the status code of the current HTTP response to which this property is attached: 

    	    string statusDescription =
		responseProperty.StatusDescription;
  • SuppressEntityBody

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the body of the message is ignored and an empty message is sent.

    public bool SuppressEntityBody { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the message body is suppressed; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    This property is used for empty message responses, for example, a service that accepts a POST request and returns a response that contains no message body with StatusCode = 200 and StatusDescription = OK. The HttpResponseMessageProperty associated with this response has this property set to true.

    Example

    This shows how to suppress the message body: 

    	    // A value of true suppresses the message body.
	    responseProperty.SuppressEntityBody =  true;
  • SuppressPreamble

    Gets or sets whether the message preamble is suppressed.

    public bool SuppressPreamble { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the message preamble is suppressed; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The SuppressPreamble property enables users to write content into the OutputStream from within a WCF operation body. This takes effect only on webhosted scenarios. The SuppressPreamble property is false by default.

    Warning

    If the SuppressPreamble property is set to true, you must set the headers, content-type, status code on the response because WCF will no longer do it.

    The following code shows an example of how to do this. 

    public class Service1 : IService1  
{  
   public void GetData()  
   {  
      HttpContext hc = HttpContext.Current;  
      string str = @"<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8"" ?>";  
      byte[] buffer = new byte[str.Length];  
      buffer = ASCIIEncoding.UTF8.GetBytes(str);  

      // enable the property  
      HttpResponseMessageProperty responseProperty = new HttpResponseMessageProperty();  
      responseProperty.SuppressPreamble = true;  
      OperationContext.Current.OutgoingMessageProperties[HttpResponseMessageProperty.Name] = responseProperty;  

      // set the response   
      hc.Response.StatusCode = 200;  
      hc.Response.ContentType = "text/xml; charset=utf-8";  
      hc.Response.ClearContent();  
      hc.Response.Flush();  

      hc.Response.OutputStream.Write(buffer, 0, buffer.Length);  
     hc.Response.Flush();  
   }  
}

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IMessageProperty.CreateCopy()

    Creates a new copy of the current instance.

    System.ServiceModel.Channels.IMessageProperty IMessageProperty.CreateCopy ();

    Returns

    • IMessageProperty

      A newly created copy of type IMessageProperty of the current instance.
